Sentencas: Here we demonstrated a simple low-cost approach to dramatically increase the power density of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) using an improved anode functional layer (AFL) structure.
Titulo: Bimodally integrated anode functional layer for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: By infiltrating a very small amount (similar to 2 wt%) of Ni and Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95(GDC) precursor solution into a submicron-sized, colloidally deposited AFL, a high power density cost-effective bimodally integrated AFL (BI-AFL) was produced.
Titulo: Bimodally integrated anode functional layer for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Microstructural analysis of this BI-AFL revealed that the superimposed ultra-fine features surrounding a submicron Ni-GDC particulate structure remained even after high temperature sintering.
Titulo: Bimodally integrated anode functional layer for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Applying this BI-AFL on an anode-supported SOFC yielded a maximum power density (MPD) of similar to 1.2 W cm(-2) at 600 degrees C, a similar to 3x increase compared to SOFC without an AFL.
Titulo: Bimodally integrated anode functional layer for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance results showed a striking decrease in both ohmic and non-ohmic electrode area specific resistances (ASR) compared to SOFCs with either no AFL or a conventional AFL.
Titulo: Bimodally integrated anode functional layer for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The effect of the BI-AFL structure on improving SOFC performance was even greater at lower temperature.
Titulo: Bimodally integrated anode functional layer for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These results indicate that a network structure with bimodal particle size distribution in the AFL dramatically increased triple phase boundary (TPB) length and enhanced the interfacial contact between anode and electrolyte.
Titulo: Bimodally integrated anode functional layer for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells
